error_adding_schedule: âŒ It appears that the instruction entered does not follow the correct format. Entered: $1 Usage: /schedule CRON run/stop/restart container /schedule CRON mute minutes /schedule CRON exec contenedor OUTPUT(0 - No, 1 - Yes) command Example: /schedule 0 1 run micontainer /schedule 30 4 mute 5 /schedule 15 2 * exec micontainer 1 cat /tmp/logs If you are not familiar with CRON statements, here you have a website to generate it following the standard.

menu: ğŸ«¡ Docker Controller Bot at your service Available commands: Â· /list Complete list of containers. Â· /run Starts a container. Â· /stop Stops a container. Â· /restart Restarts a container. Â· /exec Run a command in a container. Â· /delete Delete a container. Â· /checkupdate Update a container. Â· /updateall Update all containers Â· /changetag Change container tag. âš ï¸ Â· /logs Shows the last logs of a container. Â· /logfile Shows the last logs of a container in file format. Â· /schedule Scheduling module. Â· /compose Extracts the docker-compose from a container. âš ï¸ Â· /prune Clean up unused objects on the system. Â· /mute <minutes> Mute notifications. Â· /info Displays information about a container. Â· /version Displays the current version. Â· /donate Donate to the developer Â· /donors Heroes of Docker-Controller-Bot âš ï¸ This function is in experimental phase.
menu_exec: Run a command in a container
menu_logfile: Shows the complete logs of a container in file format
menu_logs: Shows the latest logs of a container
menu_prune:
Prune allows you to remove unused objects from the system. 

Please select the type of object to prune.

user_not_admin: âŒ This bot does not belong to you. If you want to control your docker containers via telegram deploy me on your server. Take a look at DockerHub where you will find a docker-compose. Are you curious? The code is published on GitHub. If you have questions, ask me, I'm @dgongut
version: âš™ï¸ Version: $1 Developed with â¤ï¸ by @dgongut If you find any bugs or suggestions, contact me. You can find everything related to this bot at DockerHub or on GitHub. To watch the news channel in Spanish, click here.

schedule_ask_cron: â° Enter the cron expression (e.g., '0 0 * * *' for daily at midnight, visit crontab.guru) Or use shortcuts: @yearly - Run once a year on January 1st at midnight @monthly - Run once a month on the 1st at midnight @weekly - Run once a week on Sunday at midnight @daily - Run once a day at midnight @hourly - Run once an hour at the start of the hour @reboot - Run once at system startup
